intro: Cornutia obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed cornutia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant features opposite, ovate to obovate leaves with smooth or slightly hairy surfaces. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. Cornutia obovata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides.
